user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CountSemCreate_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_CountSemCreate_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, uint32 sem_initial_value, uint32 options)
{
    OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_count_sem_table, *token);

    if (sem_initial_value > SEM_VALUE_MAX)
    {
        return OS_INVALID_SEM_VALUE;
    }

    if (sem_init(&impl->id, 0, sem_initial_value) < 0)
    {
        return OS_SEM_FAILURE;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_CountSemCreate_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t OS_impl_count_sem_table[OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES]
...
typedef struct
{
    sem_t id;
} OS_impl_countsem_internal_record_t
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_INVALID_SEM_VALUE (-20)
...
#define OS_SEM_FAILURE (-6)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_count_sem_table, *token);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. The fragment expands to &OS_impl_count_sem_table[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(token)] and does not invoke any <string.h> functions (memcpy/memmove/strcpy/etc.). Therefore Rule 21.17 (which specifically concerns the use of string.h functions and bounds of their pointer parameters) is not violated. Note: there is a separate potential risk of an out‑of‑bounds array access if token->obj_idx is not validated (i.e. >= OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES), but that would breach a different MISRA rule concerning array bounds/valid indices, not Rule 21.17.
